description: When you engage an enemy in melee combat, they are forced to acknowledge you. When an enemy you are engaged with makes a move against anyone other than you, you may attempt to stop them. If you do, roll+INT. On a 18+, their move is cancelled - their attack is blocked, their escape route cut off, their spell interrupted. On a 9-17, you intercept their move - rather than who they were originally aiming for, they hit you.

name: Constitution Training
description:
When you have undergone rigorous training to toughen your body, you gain the following benefits:

  • When you roll +CON, you add +1 to your roll.
  • Your maximum HP is increased by 5.

In addition, you gain the following move:

Iron Will: When you are subjected to a mental effect that would alter your behavior or compel you to act against your will, you can roll +CON to resist it. On a 18+, you successfully resist the effect. On a 9-17, you still resist the effect, but suffer a penalty of some sort. On a miss, the effect takes hold.

name: Mercenary
description:
You have spent your career fighting for whoever is willing to pay the most. You are well-equipped and well-trained, able to handle a wide variety of weapons and equipment. You are able to carry on your many weapons on many places of your body. For each of these body parts choose what kind of weapon you have and are carrying.

  • Left Shoulder: Poleaxe / Halberd / Spear
  • Right Shoulder: Broadsword / Gladius / Scimitar
  • Left Arm: Dagger / Short Sword / Mace
  • Right Arm: Hammer / Flail / Battle Axe
  • Left Belt: Throwing Knives / Daggers / Long Dagger
  • Right Belt: Quiver / Blowgun / Crossbow Bolts
  • Back Left Belt: Mace / Axe / Sword
  • Back Right Belt: Mace / Axe / Sword
  • Left Front Chest: Quiver / Horn / Dagger
  • Right Front Chest: Drum / Cymbals / Dagger
  • Left Upper Leg: Throwing Axes / Flail / Scythe
  • Right Upper Leg: Boomerang / Hook Sword / Sling
  • Left Lower Leg: Shuriken / Nunchucks / Knuckles
  • Right Lower Leg: Throwing Daggers / Knuckles / Blowdarts
  • Left Foot: Throwing Stars / Scimitar / Dagger
  • Right Foot: Blowdarts / Mace / Dagger

Your experience has taught you how to switch between weapons almost instantaneously, allowing you to take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself. When you use the Hack and Slash basic move, you may choose to switch to a new weapon as part of the attack, allowing to gain +1 on that roll.

You also gain these bonds:

  • I unlocked my combat skills thanks to my need to survive / a live or die situation / intensive training
  • I am a member of a mercenary guild / a freelance soldier / a member of a specialized military unit
  • I have trained through grueling physical conditioning / rigorous weapon training / real-life combat experience

name: Field Engineer
description:
You carry a unique siege weapon, a formidable tool of destruction that you have mastered and made your own. It can be collapsed into a backpack , such a portable ballista or a cannon. Unpacking and packing your siege weapon requires 1 minute. Your weapon is 5-weight; give it a name, describe it, and tell us how it came into your possession. The range of your weapon is Far (200 m), you start with 1 Siege Ammunition. Siege weapon ammunition (1 ammo, 10 coins, 1 weight).

Pick two enhancements it has:

  • Ranged: The range of your weapon becomes Very Far (500 m).
  • Explosive: It has the explosive tag, causing widespread destruction to those caught in its blast.
  • Precise: It has the precise tag, allowing for accurate shots even at long distances (can hit an apple from 200 meters).
  • Multi-shot: It can fire 3 multiple shots in quick succession.
  • Reinforced: It is made of sturdy materials, can withstand heavy damage and can provide cover.
  • Mobile: It can be easily moved and set up in different locations as it was a cart.

name: Not to be Trifled With
description: Your iron fist commands respect. When you Parley using threats of violence as leverage, you may roll +STR instead of +CHA.

name: Deathless
description: You’ve escaped Death’s grasp once before and lived to tell the tale; its embrace no longer fazes you. When you take your Last Breath, you may roll +CON.

name: Keen-Eyed
description: Nothing escapes your notice. When you Discern Realities, add the following question to the list: “How can I turn this situation to my advantage?”

name: Impressive Poise
description: Your grace and wit take people by surprise. When you catch someone off-guard with your quick reflexes or thinking, you take +1 Forward against them.

name: Armoured
description: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear.

name: Signature Weapon
description:
Your weapon is 2-weight; give it a name, describe it, and tell us how it came into your possession.

Choose the most appropriate range for your weapon:

  • Hand
  • Close
  • Reach
  • Near

Then pick two enhancements it has:

  • It glows in the presence of ________ (goblins, mages, etc)
  • Grisly: It deals +1 damage and is vicious.
  • Sharp or Spiked: It has 2-piercing.
  • Versatile: It has an additional range.
  • Huge: It has the messy and forceful tags.
  • Well-Crafted: It has -1 weight.
  • Perfectly-Weighted: It has the precise tag.

name: Intelligence Training
description:
When you have studied intensely to expand your intellect, you gain the following benefits:

  • When you roll +INT, you add +1 to your roll.
  • Your maximum MP is increased by 3.

In addition, you gain the following move:

Arcane Insights: When you study a magical object, place or phenomenon, you can ask the GM any one question about it, which they must answer truthfully.

name: Riddle of Steel
description:
When you Discern Realities in combat, take +1.

When you engage a sentient foe in combat, you may ask one of the following questions; the GM will answer you truthfully:

  • What do they expect to achieve?
  • What are they trying to hide?
  • What emotion drives them?

name: Charisma Training
description:
When you have honed your social skills to charm and persuade others, you gain the following benefits:

  • When you roll +CHA, you add +1 to your roll.

In addition, you gain the following move:

Silver Tongue: When you speak to someone, roll+CHA. On a 18+, they will do what you ask if they are able. On a 9-17, they are willing to help but only if you do something for them first. On a miss, they become hostile and may take action against you.

name: Wisdom Training
description:
When you spend time in quiet contemplation and prayer to hone your senses, roll+WIS. On a 18+, hold 3. On a 9-17, hold 1. You may spend your hold to ask the following questions at any time:

  • What here is not as it appears to be?
  • What here is useful or valuable to me?
  • What should I be on the lookout for?
  • What is about to happen?
  • What happened here recently?

name: Arcane Training
description: You have extensive training in the arcane arts, and can draw upon your knowledge to gain insight into magical phenomena. When you encounter a magical effect or creature, you may roll+Int. On a 18+, you understand the nature and origin of the magic, and gain +1 forward to discern realities or spout lore related to it. On a 9-17, you have some knowledge of the magic, but it is incomplete or outdated, and you only gain +1 forward if you act on the information immediately. On a miss, the magic overwhelms you, and you suffer -1 ongoing to all rolls related to magic until you receive a moment of rest or a counteracting spell.

name: Pyromancy
description:
When you call upon the power of fire to achieve your goals, roll+Cha. On a 18+, choose three from the list below. On a 9-17, choose two:

  • You create an explosion, dealing damage to all creatures in the area
  • You shape flames to your will, directing them to move or change shape as you desire
  • You ignite a nearby object or surface, causing it to burst into flames
  • You intimidate or frighten others with displays of fiery power
  • You protect yourself from fire and heat

On a miss, the fire you call upon burns out of control, causing harm to yourself or your allies.

name: Arcane Specialization: Abjuration
description: You can create and maintain one shield of force at a time; whoever wields it treats it as a shield (+1 armour).

name: Connections
description: When you put out word to the criminal underbelly about something you want or need, roll+CHA. On a 18+, someone has it, just for you. On a 9-17, you’ll have to settle for something close or it comes with strings attached, your call.

name: Escape Route
description: When things go south and you need a way out, name your escape route and roll+DEX. On a 18+, you’re gone. On a 9-17, you can stay or go, but if you go it will cost you; the GM will say what you leave behind or bring with you.

name: Evasion
description: When you Defy Danger, on a 12+, you transcend the danger. You not only do what you set out to do, but the GM will offer you a better outcome, a moment or true beauty, or a show of unearthly grace.

name: Cunning Dilettante
description: Gain one non-multiclass move of your choice from any class list. Treat your level for this move as if you were one level lower.

name: Leave No Trace
description:
You are preternaturally silent, and will never make noise unless you choose to. You never need to Defy Danger to act quietly.

Whenever you like, you may ask the GM “where’s the best hiding place?” and they’ll tell you the truth.

name: Shoot First
description: You’re never caught by surprise. When an enemy would get the drop on you, you get to act first instead.

name: Arcane Specialization: Conjuration
description: You can conjure a simple invisible construct that can do nothing but carry 3 Load of items.

name: Arcane Specialization: Divination
description: You can telepathically communicate with one person you can see within near range.

name: Arcane Specialization: Transmutation
description: With a touch, you can temporarily change one fundamental feature of a willing person for about an hour. Lungs can become gills, arms can become wings, and so on.

name: Tricks of the Trade
description: When you pick locks or pockets or disable traps, roll+DEX. On a 18+, you do it, no problem. On a 9-17, you still do it, but the GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost.

name: Poisoner
description:
You’ve mastered the care and use of poisons; they are no longer dangerous for you to use. Choose a poison from the list below; you know the recipe for it.

  • Oil of Tagit: Applied. The target falls into a light sleep for INT minutes (Cost: 50)
  • Bloodweed: Touch. The target inflicts -2 Damage Ongoing for INT minutes (Cost: 20)
  • Goldenroot: Applied. The target treats the next creature they see as a trusted ally, until proved otherwise for INT minutes (Cost: 50)
  • Serpent’s Tears: Touch. Anyone dealing damage to the target deals +2 Damage for INT minutes (Cost: 20)

When you have time to dissect and analyze a poison, you learn its recipe. When you have time to gather materials and a safe space to brew, you can make three uses of any poison you know the recipe. Each potion has a cost for the raw materials which doesn’t include special and unique ingredients.

name: Dirty Fighting
description:
When you and an ally flank an enemy and you make an attack against them, choose one:

  • You create an advantage or an opening; your ally takes +1 Forward to act on it.
  • You reduce their armour by 1 until they repair it.
  • You take something they’re carrying; now it’s yours.

name: Cheap Shot
description: When you Ambush someone with a hand or precise weapon, your attack is Brutal (you roll damage twice and take the best results) and you treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-17.

name: Heist
description:
When you take time to make a plan to steal something, name the thing you want to steal and ask the GM these questions. You and your allies take +1 Forward when acting on the answers.

  • Who will notice it’s missing?
  • What’s its most powerful defense?
  • Who will come after it?
  • Who else wants it?

name: Underdog
description: When you’re outnumbered, you take +1 to Defy Danger or to even the odds.

name: All in the Wrist
description:
Daggers and knives you wield get the thrown and near tags, and you can always Ambush with them.
You also keep a brace of iron throwing knives (near, 2 ammo, 1 weight) on your person; When you Supply, you may restock it for free.

name: Nothing Up My Sleeve
description: When you conceal a small object (weight 0) on your person, no one can find it unless you are bound, stripped, and thoroughly searched. You can conceal up to DEX items this way.

name: Wealth and Taste
description: When you make a show of flashing a possession which appears valuable, name an NPC present. They will do anything to obtain your item, or one like it.

name: Hideout
description:
You have a headquarters, secret lair, or safe haven that you call your own - a decrepit library, perhaps, or an abandoned keep. Detail it, and choose 3 features it has.

  • It is carefully hidden, concealed from prying eyes.
  • It is laden with traps and secret passageways.
  • It has fortified or warded walls, windows, and doors.
  • A week’s worth of food and water.
  • A workshop and tools.
  • A library of old books and tomes.
  • A few uses each of Adventuring Gear and Bandages.
  • A handful of skilled assistants or associates.

When you utilise your Hideout’s features, take +1 to your roll.

name: Envenom
description: When you apply a poison that you’ve used before to your weapon, it’s touch instead of applied. When you discreetly apply a poison to a target, such as with a pinprick, they won’t even notice.

name: Brewer
description:
When you have time to gather materials and a safe place to brew, you can describe the effects of a poison you’d like to create; the GM will tell you that you can create it, but with one or more caveats:

  • It will only work under specific circumstances.
  • The best you can manage is a weaker version.
  • It’ll take a while for the effects to manifest.
  • It’ll have obvious side effects.

name: Danger Sense
description:
You can always ask the GM, ‘’Is there an ambush or trap here?’’. If they say ‘’ yes,’’ roll +INT: on a 18+, ask the GM both questions; on a 9-17, ask 1:

  • What will trigger the trap or ambush?
  • What will happen once it’s triggered?

On a 1-8, don’t mark XP, but nothing bad happens just yet.

name: Backstab
description:
When you attack someone up close and personal and they don’t see it coming, you deal your damage (as normal) and may choose to push your luck. If you do, roll+DEX. On a 18+, choose 2. On a 9-17, choose 1.

  • You deal +1d6 damage.
  • They don’t cry out, make noise, or draw attention.
  • You stun or hamper them, at least for the moment.
  • You slip away before they can react.
  • Strike a weak spot, ignoring their armor.
  • You create an opportunity; you or an ally gain advantage if you act on it.

name: Arcane Specialization: Illusion
description: You can create and maintain one lifelike illusion at a time, for as long as you concentrate. A lifelike illusion either looks, sounds, feels, smells, or tastes real and authentic.

name: Arcane Specialization: Necromancy
description: You can harm others with an agonizing touch (hand); if you damage them, heal 1 damage.

name: Commune
description:
When you call upon the power of fate to achieve your goals, roll+Wis. On a 18+, choose three from the list below. On a 9-17, choose two:

  • You glimpse the future, gaining advantage on your next roll
  • You reveal a hidden truth, discerning realities about something or someone
  • You alter the odds, changing the outcome of a random event in your favor
  • You sense danger, avoiding a trap or an ambush
  • You protect yourself from psychic damage and mind-affecting effects

On a miss, the power of fate turns against you, causing you to suffer a -1 ongoing until you make amends.

name: Arcane Specialization: Enchantment
description: With a touch, you can grant or revoke an emotion - affection, anger, sadness, fear - for a few minutes.

name: Arcane Volley
description: You can fire small, magical projectiles (near); when you use them to Volley, you may choose to take 2 damage (ignoring armour) instead of expending ammo on a 9-17.

name: Arcane Specializtion: Evocation
description: You can fire small, magical projectiles (near); when you use them to Volley, you may choose to take 2 damage (ignoring armour) instead of expending ammo on a 9-17.

name: Shapeshifting
description:
When you call upon the power of nature to achieve your goals, roll+Con. On a 18+, choose three from the list below. On a 9-17, choose two:

  • You transform into an animal of your choice that you have studied
  • You gain the abilities and instincts of your animal form
  • You retain your own mind and personality while in animal form
  • You can communicate with other animals of the same kind as you
  • You protect yourself from environmental hazards and natural attacks

On a miss, the power of nature overwhelms you, causing you to lose control of your animal form until you calm down.

name: Spell Channeling
description:
Requires also Arcane Knowledge

When you deeply meditate or drink a dose of Quicksilver and travel mentally to the astral plane, you start to channel a spell into your arcane focus. Spend 1 mp (magic point) and choose two Words that you have ‘memorized’ to create a Sentence and roll+Con. On a 12+, hold 6 focus, on a 18+, hold 3 Focus. On a 9-17, hold 2 Focus. Your spell will always have the Hand and Dangerous tag and its effects lasts for 6 seconds. Spend 1 focus for:

  • Add one Word (and its tags) that you have ‘ memorized’
  • Your spell does + md (magic damage) if your arcane focus is a staff
  • Your spell effect lasts for 1 minute if your arcane focus is a sphere crystal
  • Take +1 when you will cast this spell if your arcane focus is a wand
  • Take +1 to defy danger while channeling this spell if you are not wearing armor or holding shields
  • Remove the Hand or Dangerous tag from your spell’s sentence

While one spell is ongoing, you can’t use another. You can end an ongoing spell whenever you wish.

name: Empower Item
description: Requires time and safety with a magical item in a place of power. When you empower that item, the next time you use it its effects are amplified. The GM will tell you exactly how.

name: Counterspell
description:
When you attempt to counter an arcane spell targeting you as it is being cast, roll+INT. On a 18+, choose 2. On a 9-17, choose 1.

  • The spell deals no damage.
  • The spell’s effects are superficial and temporary.
  • You take +1 Forward against the caster.

name: Protective Counter
description: Requires level 6+ and the Counterspell feature. When an ally you can see is targeted by an arcane spell, you can counter that spell as if it targeted you. If the spell targets multiple allies you must counter for each separately.

name: Eidetic Spellcasting
description: Whenever you spend time meditating over your spellbooks, choose two Words that you have memorized or have memorized in the past. Whenever you Channel a spell and create a sentence with those two words, you may automatically channel it as if you rolled a 7 (and you hold 1 focus).

name: Spell Knowledge
description: You can memorize an additional word.

name: Sage Advice
description: When a character comes to you for guidance and you tell them what you honestly think is best, they take +1 Forward to follow your advice and do as you say.

name: Ritual
description:
When you want to achieve a powerful magical effect, tell the GM what you’re trying to achieve. Ritual effects are always possible, but the GM will give you 1 to 4 of the following conditions (separated by ANDs and ORs):

  • It’s going to take days/weeks/months.
  • First you must ________.
  • You’ll need help from ________.
  • It will require ________.
  • The effect will be unreliable or limited.
  • You and your allies will risk danger from ________.
  • You’ll have to disenchant ________ to do it.

When you perform a Ritual while accessing a source of great magical power, you may ignore one requirement of your choice. Ritual examples: Teleporting to a distant location; dominating a weak-willed creature; communicating between the planes; locating or viewing items, creatures, or places from afar.

name: Spell Casting
description:
Requires also Arcane Knowledge

When you spell out the sentence of a spell that you are already channeling (see Spell Channeling) from your arcane focus, interpret its sentence meaning to define its effect and roll+Int. On a 18+ it is cast. On a 9-17 choose one:

  • You draw unwelcome attention from a chaos being or put yourself in a spot.
  • The spell also creates an unintended side effect.
  • Gain a debility to an ability score
  • You take 1d6 damage.

name: Arcane Knowledge
description:
You know how to tap into arcane constructs called Astral Words - locations in the astral plane that allow you to channel a spell. You can have at maximum 5 memorized words. You can change which words you have memorized by studying for 1 hour any spellbook you have access to and the words it contains.

Choose 4 words that your starting spellbook contains and that you have memorized:

Presso (Crushing)Nebula (Obscuring)Perforando (Piercing)
Ligo (Binding)Augmen (Growth)Speculo (Deflecting)
Perplexum (Confusing)Sigillo (Sealing)Gelo (Frost)
Flagro (Fire)Lux (Light)Animus (Mind)
Torpento (Stunning)Bombarda (Explosion)Tractus (Pull)
Impulso (Push)Conum (Cone)Corpus (Body)
Mano (Hand)Radio (Ray)Levo (Lifting)
Barriera (Barrier)Circus (Circle)Incanto (Enchant)

name: Bardic Lore
description:
Choose an area of expertise:

  • Spells and Magicks
  • The Dead and Undead
  • Grand Histories of the Known World
  • A Bestiary of Creatures Unusual
  • The Planes of Existence
  • Legends of Heroes and Villains
  • Gods and Their Servants

When you first encounter an important creature, location, or item (your call) covered by your area of expertise, you can ask the GM any one question about it; the GM will answer truthfully. The GM may then ask you what tale, song, or legend you heard that information in.

name: Thieves' Guild
description: You have joined the thieves' guild and learned the secrets of stealth. You can use the rogue moves and pick locks, pockets, and traps. When you spout lore or discern realities about something related to the criminal underworld, take +1 to your roll.

name: Bardic College
description: You have attended the bardic college and learned the secrets of music. You can use the bard moves and play any instrument. When you spout lore or discern realities about something related to art, culture, or history, take +1 to your roll.

name: Arcane Algebra
description:
Requires also Arcane Knowledge

When you spend time studying your spellbooks you may decide to write down in a spellbook an Astral Word by combining other two words (the word doesn’t need to be a real one, for example combining Animus and Impulso could create the word ‘ Anipulso’ which means ‘Pushing the mind’.) The cost of the spellbook page and for the ink its equal to 100 coins.

name: Martial Training
description: You have trained in the art of combat and learned the secrets of war. You can use the fighter moves and wield any weapon. When you spout lore or discern realities about something related to warfare, take +1 to your roll.

name: Charming and Open
description:
When you speak frankly with someone, you can ask their player a question from the list below. They must answer it truthfully, then they may ask you a question from the list (which you must answer truthfully).

  • Whom do you serve?
  • What do you wish I'd do?
  • How can I get you to ___?
  • What are you really feeling right now?
  • What do you most desire?

name: Dwarf
description:
Mountain-Born.

You are acclimated to high altitudes and cold climates. You take no penalties for elevation and are able to keep warm in cold environments without extra gear.

Unyielding.

When you take damage and would be knocked prone, you may instead remain standing and take +1 forward to your next attack.

Stonework.

When you discern realities or spout lore about stonework, take +1 to your roll. When you defy danger in a stonework environment, you may take +1 forward to your roll.

name: Elf
description:
Keen Senses.

You have advantage on perception checks that rely on sight or hearing.

Elven Grace.

When you defy danger by acting with grace or precision, you may roll +DEX instead of the usual stat.

Fey Ancestry.

You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic cannot put you to sleep.

name: Halfling
description:
Lucky.

When you roll a 1-8 on a move, you may reroll one of the dice once (but you must keep the new result).

Brave.

You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Nimble.

You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

name: A Port in the Storm
description:
When you return to a civilized settlement you've visited before, tell the GM when you were last here. They'll tell you how it's changed since then.

When you first visit a civilized settlement, someone who respects the custom of hospitality to minstrels will take you in as their guest.

name: Duelist's Parry
description:
When you hack and slash with a rapier, dagger, or other precise blade, you can choose to deal your damage or roll+Dex. On a 18+ choose two. On a 7–9 choose one.

  • You avoid their attack, you don't have to roll for damage
  • You deal your damage+1d4
  • You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it
  • You impress, dismay, or frighten your enemy

name: Half-Orc
description:
Savage.

When you hack and slash an enemy, you can choose to deal +1d4 damage but expose yourself to the enemy's attack.

Relentless.

When you are reduced to 0 HP, you can make a CON roll. On a 18+, you are still alive and conscious with 1 HP. On a 9-17, you are unconscious but stable. On a 1-8, you die as normal.

Bloodlust.

When you kill an enemy in combat, you heal 1d6 HP.

name: Gnome
description:
Clever.

When you spout lore or discern realities about something related to magic, technology, or nature, take +1 to your roll.

Tinker.

You can create small devices or gadgets that have minor magical or mechanical effects. You need access to tools and materials, and it takes some time and a roll to determine the quality and duration of your creation.

Small Stature.

You have disadvantage on strength checks and saving throws that involve brute force or size. You have advantage on stealth checks and saving throws that involve hiding or escaping.

name: Tiefling
description:
Infernal Legacy.

You know the prestidigitation cantrip. When you reach level 2, you can cast hellish rebuke once per day as a level 1 spell. When you reach level 4, you can cast darkness once per day as a level 2 spell. Your spellcasting ability is CHA for these spells.

Fiendish Resistance.

You have resistance to fire damage.

Dark Reputation.

You have disadvantage on charisma checks when dealing with people who are prejudiced or fearful of your fiendish heritage. You have advantage on intimidation checks when you reveal your true nature or make a threat.

name: Samurai
description:
Bushido Code.

You live by the strict code of the samurai, which emphasizes honor, loyalty, and bravery. You gain +1 to damage when attacking an opponent in single combat, and +1 to AC when defending against multiple foes.

Katana Mastery.

You are trained in the use of the katana, a deadly and elegant sword. You gain +1 to hack and slash rolls when wielding a katana.

Seppuku.

If you fail a roll and suffer a catastrophic failure, you may choose to perform seppuku (ritual suicide) instead. Your character dies, but the rest of the party gains a +1 forward.

name: Viking
description:
Berserker Rage.

When you enter a frenzied rage, you gain +1 to damage and +1 to hack and slash rolls. You also take +1 damage from all sources.

Thor's Blessing.

You have the favor of the thunder god, Thor. Once per day, you can call upon him for aid, gaining a +1 bonus to a single roll. This blessing comes at a price, however, as Thor demands tribute in the form of a valuable item or sacrifice.

Skaldic Poetry.

You are a skilled poet and storyteller, and your tales can inspire your companions to greatness. Once per day, you can recite a poem or story that grants +1 forward to a roll made by a party member.

name: Maori Warrior
description:
Haka Dance.

You can perform a Haka Dance before battle to intimidate your enemies and bolster your allies. Roll+CHA to inspire your allies or frighten your foes.

Pounamu Weaponry.

You are skilled in the use of traditional Maori weapons, such as the Taiaha, Patu, or Mere. You have a +1 bonus to hack and slash rolls when using these weapons.

Ancestral Connection.

You have a strong connection to your ancestors and the spirits of nature. You can commune with them to gain insight, guidance, or assistance.

stats.stat_value: Must be a Maori or have a Maori mentor

name: Alchemical Expertise
description:
You are an alchemist, trained in the art of transmutation and the creation of magical potions. You start knowing the recipe for two of these potions:

  • Love Poison: Ingested or applied. The target becomes infatuated with the first creature they see, and will do anything to win their affection until the poison wears off after INT hours. (Cost: 30)
  • Hallucinogen: Ingested or inhaled. The target experiences vivid and often disturbing hallucinations for INT hours (Cost: 20)
  • Polymorph Poison: Ingested or applied. The target's body transforms into a random animal form for INT hours (Cost: 20)
  • Amnesia Poison: Ingested or applied. The target forgets everything that happened in the past 24 hours, and may have difficulty remembering new information for INT hours (Cost: 50)
  • Time Warp Poison: Ingested or applied. The target's perception of time is altered, making it seem as if time is moving much faster or slower than it actually is for INT minutes (Cost: 50)

name: Eye for Value
description: You’ve got an eye for wealth and value. You can always tell if something is fake, and when you Discern Realities, you can always ask “What did I found and I’m holding in my hand that is useful or valuable for me?” in addition to your other questions. You always find something valuable, either hidden somewhere or by pickpocketing someone.

name: Bedouin human
description:
Nomadic.

You have advantage on discern realities or spout lore rolls that relate to survival or travel. You can easily navigate terrain and find food and water in arid environments. You also have disadvantage on charisma checks when dealing with settled folk who are not used to your ways.

Desert Survivalist.

You have resistance to fire damage and advantage on saving throws against extreme heat or cold. You can also track creatures or individuals through the desert, and you have a +1 bonus to hack and slash rolls when using a weapon that you have crafted from desert materials.

Camel Companion.

You have a trained camel companion who can carry you and your gear through the desert. Your camel is a loyal ally and can be commanded to perform simple tasks, such as guarding your campsite or carrying messages. Your camel is not trained for combat, however, and will flee from danger unless properly trained.

name: Turinese human
description:
Mechanical Aptitude.

You gain proficiency in tinkering with mechanical devices and can make repairs to them quickly. You also have advantage on intelligence checks related to engineering or machinery.

Steam-Powered.

You have a special connection to steam power and can use it to augment your abilities. Once per day, you can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your intelligence modifier by tapping into the power of a nearby steam engine or boiler.

Vulnerable to Electrification.

You have disadvantage on saving throws against lightning or electric damage.

name: Catholic
description:
Devout.

You have a deep connection to the divine and a strong sense of faith. When you perform a religious ceremony or ritual, take +1 to your roll.

Blessed by the Church.

You have the support and protection of the Roman Catholic Church. You can call upon the Church's resources to aid you in your quests or missions. However, you may also be called upon to perform tasks or missions for the Church.

Holy Sites.

You are familiar with the many holy sites and relics of Rome, and you know how to use them to your advantage. When you are in Rome or dealing with matters related to the Church, take +1 to your roll.

name: Roman human
description:
Ancient History.

You have extensive knowledge of Rome's rich history and arcane lore. When you spout lore or discern realities about ancient magical artifacts or items in Rome, take +1 to your roll.

Ancient Artifacts.

You have a talent for identifying and understanding the magical properties of ancient artifacts and items. When you examine an ancient artifact or item, roll+Int. On a 18+ you gain a useful insight into its powers and properties, on a 9-17 you gain some insight but also attract unwanted attention, and on a 1-8 the GM will tell you a hard truth about it.

Ancient Magic.

You have studied the ancient magical practices of Rome and know how to harness its power. When you cast a spell using an ancient magical component or incantation, take +1 to your spellcasting roll.

name: Bolognese human
description:
Diplomatic Skills.

When you parley with someone, you can always ask them for something even on a failure. You also get +1 forward when you act on the information you gathered through a successful parley.

Master Alchemist.

You have the ability to create powerful potions and remedies. When you have access to an alchemy lab, you can create potions and remedies that can heal injuries, cure diseases, and grant temporary boosts to physical or mental abilities.

Bolognese Mediators.

You are part of the Bolognese Mediators, a group of skilled negotiators who are often called upon to resolve conflicts between different races. You gain +1 forward when you attempt to mediate a conflict or negotiate a treaty between different factions or races.

name: Forlivese human
description:
Skilled Farmers.

You have expertise in raising animals and growing crops. You can identify the best quality livestock and crops, and you can care for them to ensure they remain healthy and productive. You gain +1 forward when you act on information you have learned about animals or crops.

Forlivesi Brutes.

You are part of the Forlivesi Brutes, a group of formidable warriors who are renowned for their physical prowess. You gain +1 forward when you use brute force to accomplish a task, such as breaking down a door or lifting heavy objects.

Livestock Trade.

You have connections in the livestock industry, and you can trade in high-quality meats. When you try to sell livestock, you gain +1 forward to your roll. You also have advantage on saving throws against attempts to steal your livestock.

name: Romagnolo
description:
Culinary Tradition.

You have a deep knowledge of the culinary traditions of Romagna and can prepare delicious and nourishing meals from even the most meager of ingredients. When you make a campfire meal, take +1 to the roll.

Fierce Independence.

You are fiercely independent and self-reliant. When you defy danger on your own, take +1 to the roll.

Mystical Connection.

You have a deep connection with the natural world and the spirits that inhabit it. When you cast a spell to summon, commune with, or banish a spirit, take +1 to your spellcasting roll.

name: Lucchese human
description:
Textile Industry.

You have extensive knowledge of the textile industry of Lucca and can identify the quality and properties of any fabric or clothing. When you spout lore or discern realities about textiles or clothing, take +1 to your roll.

Strategic Prowess.

You are a master of defensive warfare and can devise strategies to protect yourself and your allies from harm. When you defend a location or an ally, take +1 to your roll.

Engineering Knowledge.

You have a deep understanding of mechanical devices and can use them to your advantage. When you use a mechanical device, take +1 to the roll.

name: Ravennese human
description:
Mystical Artistry.

You are a master of the mystical arts, and your artistry reflects this. When you spout lore or discern realities about mystical or magical subjects, take +1 to your roll.

Mystical Mosaics.

You have a talent for creating stunning and intricate mosaic artwork infused with mystical energy. When you create a magical mosaic artwork that depicts a specific subject or tells a story, roll+Cha. On a 18+, you successfully imbue the artwork with powerful magical energies that can aid your allies in combat or provide valuable insights into a situation. On a 9-17, you create the artwork, but it has unforeseen consequences or attracts unwanted attention. On a 1-8, the GM will tell you a hard truth about the artwork.

Mystical Lore.

You have studied the mystical practices of the Ravennati and know how to harness their power. When you cast a spell using a mystical component or incantation associated with Ravennati magic, take +1 to your spellcasting roll.

name: Neapolitan Hellfire legionnaire
description:
Hellfire Legion

You are a member of the infamous Neapolitan Hellfire Legion, a group of warriors and paladins who are infused with infernal energy and wield flaming swords. You are known for your fanatical devotion and your ability to channel your rage into devastating attacks. When you enter combat with an enemy, roll+Cha. On a 18+ gain 2 hold, on a 9-17 gain 1 hold. You may spend hold 1 for 1 to:

  • Deal +1d6 damage to a foe you are engaged with
  • Push yourself beyond your physical limits to ignore a condition that would otherwise impede you
  • Heal yourself or an ally you can touch 1d8 damage

You can use your hold at any time, but it expires at the end of the scene.

name: Palermitan Spice Squad
description:
Spice Magic

You are a member of the Palermitan Spice Squad, a group of expert chefs who use their magic to create delicious and nourishing meals for the troops. You have a talent for using magic to enhance the flavors and nutritional value of food. When you prepare a meal, roll+Int. On a 18+ choose 3, on a 9-17 choose 2:

  • The meal provides a +1 ongoing bonus to a specific stat or ability for the next scene
  • The meal heals 1d8 damage
  • The meal provides a temporary protection against a specific condition or damage type
  • The meal can be used as a bribe or a gift to gain favor or information

The effects of the meal last until the end of the next scene.

name: Catanian human
description:
Lava Magic.

You have studied the ways of the volcanic magic and have learned to harness its power. When you cast a spell that involves lava or fire, take +1 to your spellcasting roll.

Fertile Soil.

You have a deep connection to the earth and the soil of Catania. When you spend a day working on the land, you can heal yourself of 1d4 damage.

Fruitful Harvest.

You are a skilled farmer and have learned to cultivate delicious and nutritious fruits and vegetables. When you gather food in the wild, you always find enough for yourself and one other person, and it is always delicious and nutritious.

name: Blade of Rome
description:
Ancient Knowledge.

You have studied the history and artifacts of Rome and have gained a deep understanding of ancient lore. When you spout lore about Rome or its ruins, take +1 to your roll.

The Blades of Rome.

You have been trained by the elite paladins of The Blades of Rome, a group of holy warriors who defend the Vatican. When you aid or interfere with someone while fighting, take +1 to your roll.

name: Turinese Clockwork Knight
description:
Inventor's Mind.

You have a natural talent for inventing and tinkering with machinery. When you defy danger using your knowledge of machinery, take +1 to your roll.

Clockwork Suit.

You have been trained by the Turinese Clockwork Knights and have been given a powerful clockwork suit that enhances your strength and agility. When you enter combat while wearing your suit, take +1 to your roll.

name: Florentine Arcanum Guard
description:
Artistic Vision.

You have a keen eye for beauty and can see the art and beauty in everything. When you spout lore about art, architecture or history of Florence, take +1 to your roll.

Arcanum Guard.

You have been trained by the Arcanum Guard, a group of mages and battlemages who are trained in both defensive and offensive magic. When you cast a spell that involves elemental magic, take +1 to your spellcasting roll.

name: Venetian human
description:
Master of Disguise.

You have a natural talent for deception and disguise. When you attempt to impersonate someone, take +1 to your roll. Additionally, you can always find a way to blend in with your surroundings, giving you +1 forward to any move that involves sneaking or hiding.

Seafaring Expertise.

You have grown up in the Venetian Lagoon and have a deep understanding of the ways of the sea. When you are on a ship, take +1 forward to any move that involves sailing or navigating.

Blackwater Connections.

You have connections with the Blackwater Blades, the elite assassins of Venice. When you need their help, they will come to your aid, but at a cost.

name: Milanese human
description:
Elegant Appearance.

You are always dressed in the finest clothes and have an air of sophistication and refinement about you. When you attempt to sway someone with your charm, take +1 to your roll.

Dragon Hunter.

You have been trained in the art of dragon hunting by the Milanesi Dragonslayers. When you face a dragon in combat, take +1 forward to your attack rolls and +1 to your damage rolls.

Fashionable Gear.

You have access to the finest fabrics and the most skilled tailors in Milan. Your armor and weapons are always stylish and fashionable, giving you +1 forward to any move that involves impressing someone with your appearance.

name: Parisian human
description:
Parisian Fashion.

You have an eye for fashion and are well-versed in the latest trends of Paris. When you make a Charisma-based roll related to fashion or style, take +1 to your roll.

Magical Arrows.

You have been trained by the Parisian Muskeeters in the art of archery and imbuing your arrows with magic. When you fire an arrow, you may choose to expend a spell slot to imbue it with additional magical energy, dealing extra damage equal to your level.

Elegance and Refinement.

You have learned to embody the elegance and refinement of the Parisian lifestyle. When you interact with nobility or high society, take +1 to your Charisma-based rolls.

name: Marseillese human
description:
Exotic Spices.

You have a knack for finding and identifying exotic spices from all corners of the world. When you use spices in cooking or alchemy, take +1 to your roll.

Marseille Mermaids.

You have trained with the Marseille Mermaids and are skilled in underwater combat. When you fight underwater, take +1 to your rolls.

Toughness and Resourcefulness.

You have learned to embody the toughness and resourcefulness of the Marseillais people. When you are in a situation that requires grit and resilience, take +1 to your rolls.

name: Lyon human
description:
Silk Weaving.

You have learned the art of silk weaving, and can craft luxurious garments that are highly sought after by nobles and royalty. When you use your craft to create clothing or other items, take +1 to your roll.

Secret Society.

You are a member of a secret society in Lyon that works in the shadows to maintain the balance of power in the city. When you gather information about a person or organization that is involved in the city's politics or power struggles, take +1 to your roll.

Gryphon Training.

You have trained extensively with the Lyon Gryphons, the city's elite aerial unit. When you ride on the back of a gryphon, you take +1 ongoing to your rolls to spot, chase, or outmaneuver enemies in the sky.

name: Norman human
description:
Master Rider.

You have been trained in the art of horsemanship since childhood, and are a skilled rider. When mounted, take +1 to your Defy Danger rolls made to avoid attacks and obstacles.

Seafaring Folk.

You are at home on the sea and have spent much of your life sailing and fishing. You take +1 ongoing when you Defy Danger on a ship or other vessel.

Cunning Trapper.

You are skilled in the art of trapping and have learned to set snares and traps to catch your prey. When you set a trap, take +1 to your roll to Defy Danger when your prey is lured into the trap.

name: Bordeaux human
description:
Wine Connoisseur.

You are an expert in the art of wine-making and have an extensive knowledge of the vintages produced in Bordeaux. When you share a bottle of Bordeaux wine with someone, take +1 to your Parley roll.

Dragon's Breath.

You have learned to harness the power of fire and can breathe a cone of flame up to 30 feet long. When you unleash your Dragon's Breath, roll+Cha. On a 18+, you deal 1d8 damage to all creatures in the area. On a 9-17, you deal half damage, and the GM chooses one:

  • You take -1 forward
  • You draw unwanted attention or put someone in a spot.

Refined Tastes.

You are a connoisseur of fine things, and have a keen eye for quality. When you Spout Lore about a valuable or rare item, take +1 to your roll.

name: Golden Sun High Elf
description:
Elegant Movements.

You are known for your graceful and elegant movements, which are considered very attractive to humans. When you Parley with a human, take +1 to your roll.

Sophisticated Fashion Sense.

You have a keen eye for fashion and style. When you Spout Lore about fashion or clothing, take +1 to your roll.

Artisan.

You are skilled in the creation of magical artifacts. When you Craft a magical item, take +1 to your roll.

name: Silver Moon High Elf
description:
Musical Talent.

You are known for your soothing and melodic voice, which is often sought after for singing or public speaking. When you Aid or interfere with someone using your voice, take +1 to your roll.

Opera Performance.

You are skilled in the art of opera performance. When you Perform an opera piece, take +1 to your roll.

Bard.

You are a skilled bard. When you Cast a spell using music or singing, take +1 to your roll.

name: Radiant Dawn High Elf
description:
Keen Senses.

You have a keen sense of taste and smell, which make you an excellent judge of quality ingredients. When you Discern Realities related to food or spices, take +1 to your roll.

Exotic Spices Trade.

You are skilled in the trade of exotic spices. When you Spout Lore about exotic spices, take +1 to your roll.

Expert Cook.

You are an expert cook. When you Cook a meal, take +1 to your roll.

name: Green Forest Wood Elf
description:
Keen Senses.

You have sharp senses and excellent perception, allowing you to detect hidden dangers and opportunities. When you discern realities or spout lore about your environment, take +1 to your roll.

Stealth and Camouflage.

You are skilled at remaining unnoticed and blending into your surroundings. When you defy danger or parley while using stealth or camouflage, take +1 to your roll.

Green Forest Rangers.

You are a member of the elite Green Forest Rangers, a group of stealthy scouts who excel at gathering intelligence and ambushing enemies. When you act as part of a Green Forest Ranger unit, take +1 to your roll.

stats.stat_value: Born in Black Forest of Germany

name: Misty Vale Wood Elf
description:
Connection to Nature.

You have a deep connection to the natural world and can communicate with plants and animals. When you spout lore or discern realities about nature, take +1 to your roll.

Divination and Prophecy.

You possess a rare intuition that allows you to glimpse into the future and understand the will of the spirits. When you spout lore or discern realities about the spirit world, take +1 to your roll.

Misty Vale Shamans.

You are a member of the esteemed Misty Vale Shamans, a group of spiritual leaders who use their magic to communicate with the ancestors and call upon their aid in battle. When you act as part of a Misty Vale Shaman unit, take +1 to your roll.

stats.stat_value: Born in the Misty Vale of Wales

name: Wildflower Wood Elf
description:
Natural Perfumer.

You have a deep knowledge of plants and their fragrances, allowing you to create potent perfumes and natural remedies. When you use a Wildflower perfume, you take +1 to your Defy Danger roll against being detected by smell.

Toxicologist.

You are skilled in the use of poisons and antidotes, and can create potent toxins from the plants of the forest. When you use a Wildflower poison, roll+Int. On a 18+, you deal 1d8 damage to the target. On a 9-17, you deal half damage, and the GM chooses one:

  • You take -1 forward
  • You draw unwanted attention or put someone in a spot.

Forest Walker.

You are a master of navigating the forests of France, and can find your way through even the densest undergrowth. When you Spout Lore about the local flora and fauna, take +1 to your roll.

name: Shadowed Blade Dark Elf
description:
Assassin's Blade.

You are a skilled assassin and have been trained in the art of stealth and assassination by the Shadowed Blades. When you attack a surprised or unsuspecting enemy, deal +1d6 damage.

Shadow Step.

You have the ability to move quickly and silently through the shadows. When you use your Shadow Step to move to a new location, roll+Dex. On a 18+, you move silently and without being detected. On a 9-17, you are detected but still make it to your destination. On a miss, you are detected and the GM chooses one:

  • You take -1 forward
  • You draw unwanted attention or put someone in a spot.

Witty Banter.

You have a sharp wit and quick thinking, which can be very attractive to humans. When you Parley with someone, take +1 to your roll.

name: Bloodied Moon Dark Elf
description:
Magical Enhancement.

You have the ability to enhance your strength and endurance in combat using magic. When you Hack and Slash, roll+Con instead of Str. On a 18+, deal your damage and take no damage in return. On a 9-17, deal your damage but also take damage in return. On a miss, you take damage but deal no damage in return.

Black Market Connections.

You have connections to the black market trade in illegal magical substances and underground fight clubs. When you Spout Lore about the black market or fight clubs, take +1 to your roll.

Fierce Competitor.

You have a fierce and competitive nature, which can be very alluring to humans. When you Defy Danger, take +1 to your roll.

name: Cursed Star Dark Elf
description:
Cursebreaker.

You have a natural talent for breaking curses and hexes. When you Defy Danger to break a curse or remove a hex, take +1 to your roll.

Smuggler.

You have connections with the underworld and are skilled at smuggling goods across borders. When you Spout Lore about the location of a hidden stash or a secret smuggling route, take +1 to your roll.

Enigmatic Personality.

You have a mysterious and alluring personality that can be very seductive to humans. When you Parley with a human, take +1 to your roll.

name: Mangrove Elf
description:
Canoe-Building Expertise.

You are skilled in the art of building canoes and navigating through the dense mangrove forests of your homeland. When you travel by water in your canoe, take +1 forward to any Defy Danger roll.

Tropical Medicine.

You have an extensive knowledge of the exotic plants and herbs of the jungle. When you successfully use them to heal someone, take +1 forward to any healing rolls.

Spear-Thrower.

You are skilled in the use of the spear and are able to hit your targets with deadly accuracy. When you successfully attack with a spear, deal +1 damage.

name: Jungle Elf
description:
Expert Metalworker.

You are skilled in the art of metalworking and can create weapons and armor of exceptional quality. When you create a weapon or armor, it has the 'precise' tag.

Jungle Survivalist.

You are able to navigate through the hot and humid conditions of the jungle with ease. When you travel through the jungle, take +1 forward to any Defy Danger roll.

Striking Features.

Your angular features are considered very handsome by humans, giving you an advantage when dealing with them. When you Parley with a human using your looks, take +1 forward to your roll.

stats.stat_value: Born in jungle of Central America

name: Coral Elf
description:
Aquatic Magic.

You have an innate connection with the sea and can cast spells underwater with ease. When you Cast a Spell underwater, take +1 to your spellcasting roll.

Pearl Diver.

You are skilled in the art of diving for pearls and other valuable treasures. When you Defy Danger to navigate treacherous underwater environments, take +1 to your roll.

Siren's Song.

You can sing a haunting melody that enchants those who hear it. When you use your Siren's Song to seduce someone, roll+Cha. On a 18+, they are charmed and will do anything you ask. On a 9-17, they are charmed but will ask you to prove your loyalty first.

stats.stat_value: Born in coral reefs of the Caribbean.

name: Troll
description:
Corrupted by the Primal Lake.

You are an elf that has been corrupted by the primal lake that existed in Europe many millennia ago. Your body has been altered, giving you incredible regenerative abilities and a natural resistance to magic. However, your mind has been affected as well, making you prone to fits of berserk rage.

Shamanic Magic.

You have been trained in the ways of shamanic magic, allowing you to communicate with the spirits of the natural world and bend them to your will. When you cast a shamanic spell, take +1 to your roll.

Berserker Rage.

When you go into a berserker rage, you gain incredible strength and stamina, but you lose control of yourself and become a danger to everyone around you. Roll+Con. On a 18+, you gain the benefits of the rage without losing control. On a 9-17, choose one:

  • You lose control and attack the nearest creature
  • You lose control and cause collateral damage to the environment

Regeneration.

Your body is able to regenerate from even the most severe injuries. When you heal naturally, take +1 to your roll.

name: Orc
description:
Blood of Goblins and Humans.

You are a member of the Orcs, a race created by ancient sorcerers who mixed the blood of goblins and humans in an attempt to create a superior race. You are native to the harsh and unforgiving lands of the north, and you are known for your brute strength and fierce, warlike nature.

Brute Strength.

You possess incredible physical strength, allowing you to overpower most opponents in combat. When you attempt to break or destroy an object or structure, take +1 to your roll.

Fierce Nature.

You have a fierce, warlike nature that makes you a formidable opponent on the battlefield. When you enter combat, take +1 to your roll.

Intimidating Presence.

Your appearance and demeanor are intimidating to most creatures. When you attempt to intimidate or frighten an opponent, take +1 to your roll.

name: Ice Wolves Orc
description:
Ice Wolf Pack

You are a member of the Ice Wolves, a pack of elite hunters and trackers known for their pack mentality and endurance. When you undertake a perilous journey through the frozen wilderness, roll+Wis. On a 18+, you reach your destination safely and gain insight into the dangers ahead. On a 9-17, you reach your destination but suffer a setback, the GM will tell you what. On a miss, you become lost in the snow and ice, the GM will tell you what danger you encounter.

Frost Resistance

Your body has adapted to the freezing temperatures of the Arctic Circle. You gain +1 armor against cold-based attacks.

Ferocious Charge

When you charge into battle, you can choose to deal extra damage equal to your level, but suffer a -1 ongoing penalty to your damage rolls until you take a moment to catch your breath.

name: Frost Giants Orc
description:
Frost Giant Physiology

Your body is incredibly tough and resilient, able to withstand even the harshest conditions of the frozen mountains. You gain +1 armor against physical attacks.

Heavy Hitter

You can wield heavy weapons and armor with ease. When you deal damage with a weapon or attack that has the 'heavy' tag, you deal +1d4 damage.

Tactical Genius

You are a master of tactics and strategy, able to quickly assess a situation and come up with a plan of action. When you spout lore about a conflict or enemy, roll+Int. On a 18+, the GM will give you useful information about the situation. On a 9-17, the information is incomplete, and the GM will tell you what you need to do to get the full picture.

name: Snow Leopards Orc
description:
Snow Leopard Clan

You are a member of the Snow Leopard Clan, a group of orcs who live in the frozen forests of the Russian Taiga. You are known for your agility and speed, which make you excellent at reconnaissance and sabotage missions. When you are in a dangerous situation and need to act quickly, roll+Dex. On a 18+, hold 3, on a 9-17, hold 1. You may spend your hold 1 for 1 to:

  • Take +1 forward when you act on the information you gained through reconnaissance or sabotage
  • Avoid being detected by enemies, despite being in their line of sight
  • Move quickly and silently through an area, bypassing any traps or obstacles that would slow you down

You can use your hold at any time, but it expires at the end of the scene.

name: Poisonous Vines Orc
description:
Deadly Poison

You belong to the Poisonous Vines Orc clan, known for their skill in creating deadly poisons and stealthy assassins. When you have time to gather materials and create a deadly poison, roll+Intelligence. On a 18+, you get 3 doses. On a 9-17, you get 1 dose. When you use a poison, spend a dose to:

  • Deal +1d6 damage to a foe you hit with a melee attack
  • Paralyze a foe you hit with a ranged attack, rendering them unable to act for 1 round
  • Slow a foe you hit with a melee or ranged attack, reducing their movement speed by half for 1 round

Your poisons are always lethal, and any creature that fails to resist them dies within 1d4 rounds.

name: Rotting Trees Orc
description:
Raise Undead

You belong to the Rotting Trees Orc clan, known for their ability to summon and control undead creatures. When you use your necromancy to raise undead, roll+Wisdom. On a 18+, choose 1. On a 9-17, choose 2:

  • The undead you raise are loyal to you and obey your commands without question
  • The undead you raise are stronger and more durable than normal
  • The undead you raise have special abilities or powers

Your undead creatures are immune to pain and fear, and they will fight for you until destroyed.

name: Marsh Hags Orc
description:
Necromantic Expertise

You are a member of the Marsh Hags Orc clan, known for your expertise in necromancy. You have the ability to curse and hex your enemies, using your magic to gain the upper hand in battle. When you cast a spell to curse or hex an enemy, roll+Int. On a 18+, hold 3. On a 9-17, hold 1. You may spend hold 1 for 1 to:

  • Inflict -1d6 damage to an enemy
  • Make an enemy suffer -1 ongoing to their next action
  • Disrupt an enemy's spell or ritual

You can use your hold at any time, but it expires at the end of the scene.

stats.stat_value: Born in fens of East Anglia

name: Iron Fist Orc
description:
Iron Fist Brigade

You come from the Iron Fist Clan, known for their skilled blacksmiths and powerful weapons. As a member of the Iron Fist Orcs, you gain the following moves:

  • Iron Grip: When you successfully grapple an opponent, you can choose to deal damage instead of holding them in place.
  • Two-Handed Mastery: When you wield a two-handed weapon, add an extra +1d4 damage.
  • Armor Smith: You are skilled in the art of armor-making. When you spend a few hours working on a suit of armor, you can improve its defensive properties by +1.

name: Stone Heart Orc
description:
Stone Heart Sentinels

You come from the Stone Heart Clan, known for their impressive fortresses and heavily-armored guards. As a member of the Stone Heart Orcs, you gain the following moves:

  • Shield Wall: When you stand shoulder-to-shoulder with your allies, you can spend a hold to add +1 armor to everyone in the group.
  • Unwavering Resolve: When you are subjected to a fear effect, roll+Con. On a 18+, you shake it off and gain +1 forward against the source of the fear. On a 9-17, you are momentarily shaken but can still act. On a miss, you are overcome with fear and must flee or cower.
  • Fortress Builder: You are skilled in the art of fortification. When you spend a few hours working on a defensive structure, you can improve its defensive properties by +1.

name: Crimson Mountain Orc
description:
Bloodthirsty Raiders

You come from the Crimson Mountain Clan, known for their red-colored armor and their fearsome reputation on the battlefield. You are a member of the Crimson Mountain Raiders, a group of skilled cavalry who strike fear into the hearts of their enemies with their swift and deadly charges. When you charge into battle, roll+Con. On a 18+, you deal an additional 1d6 damage to your enemies and your enemies are afraid and hesitate. On a 9-17, choose one:

  • You deal an additional 1d4 damage to your enemies
  • You drive back your enemies, forcing them to choose between taking damage or giving ground
  • You disorient your enemies, making them vulnerable to your allies' attacks

Your ferocity and love of battle make you feared by both humans and elves, and your thirst for blood can lead you into dangerous situations. But when the battle is won, you are revered by your clan as a hero of the Crimson Mountain.

name: Iron Forge Dwarf
description:
Iron Legion

You come from the Clan of the Iron Forge, known for their expert blacksmiths and production of high-quality weapons and armor. As a Deep Dwarf of this clan, you possess physical strength and endurance, as well as tough and resilient personalities. You have been trained in the art of siege warfare as a member of the Iron Legion, a special army unit of heavily-armored soldiers.

When you use your strength to overcome an obstacle or resist an attack, roll +Str. On a 18+, you do it with ease. On a 9-17, you succeed, but choose one: You take damage, you leave something important behind, or you lose your footing and end up in a bad spot.

When you use your knowledge of siege warfare to plan or execute an assault, roll +Int. On a 18+, the assault is a resounding success. On a 9-17, the assault succeeds, but choose one: You suffer heavy losses, you take longer than expected, or you lose something important in the process.

stats.stat_value: Born in the depths of the Carpathian

name: Golden Mine Dwarf
description:
Golden Guard

You come from the Clan of the Golden Mine, known for their rich veins of gold and trade in precious metals. As a Deep Dwarf of this clan, you possess wealth and prosperity, as well as mercantile and diplomatic skills. You have been trained as a member of the Golden Guard, a special army unit of elite mercenaries hired for protection by wealthy clients.

When you use your wealth and resources to gain an advantage, roll +Cha. On a 18+, you have the perfect resource for the situation. On a 9-17, you have something useful, but it comes with a complication or cost.

When you use your mercantile and diplomatic skills to negotiate or manipulate others, roll +Wis. On a 18+, they believe your words and follow your lead. On a 9-17, they are hesitant, and you must make them an offer or provide proof to convince them.

stats.stat_value: Born in the depths of the Pyrenees

name: Dark Tunnels Dwarf
description:
Dark Tunnels Explorer

You come from the Dark Tunnels Clan, a group of dwarves renowned for their exploration and mapping of the underground tunnels and caverns of Europe. Your special abilities reflect your clan's expertise in reconnaissance and infiltration.

Darkvision

You can see in the dark as if it were daylight.

Stoneworking

You have a deep understanding of stonework and stonemasonry. When you examine stonework, roll+Wis. On a 18+, ask the GM three questions from the list below. On a 9-17, ask one question.

  • What was crafted here?
  • What is valuable here?
  • What is flawed or imperfect here?
  • What is hidden here?

Underground Expertise

You have a +1 ongoing to all rolls made to navigate underground tunnels and caverns.

stats.stat_value: Born in the depths of the Alps

name: Cloud Walkers Dwarf
description:
Cloudwalking Magic

You are a member of the Clan of the Cloud Walkers, known for your expertise in cloudwalking magic. You can walk on clouds and even soar through the skies. When you use your cloudwalking magic, roll+WIS. On a 18+, hold 3. On a 9-17, hold 2. On a 1-8, hold 1. Spend your hold to:

  • Move quickly across the clouds and avoid obstacles or enemies
  • Hide in the clouds and become invisible to enemies
  • Surprise an enemy by dropping down from the clouds and attacking them

You can use your hold at any time, but it expires at the end of the scene.

name: Sky Hunters Dwarf
description:
Hunter of the Skies

You are a member of the Clan of the Sky Hunters, known for your expertise in hunting and tracking prey from the air. You are also skilled in the art of taming and riding flying beasts. When you ride a flying beast, roll+DEX. On a 18+, gain 3 hold. On a 9-17, gain 2 hold. On a 1-8, gain 1 hold. Spend your hold to:

  • Command your beast to attack an enemy
  • Move quickly and avoid obstacles or enemies
  • Use your beast to distract an enemy or create a diversion

You can use your hold at any time, but it expires at the end of the scene.

name: Mountain Monks Dwarf
description:
Mountain Monks

You are a member of the Mountain Monks, a clan of dwarves located in the city of Kathmandu who are known for their expertise in meditation and spiritual enlightenment. You are able to harness your inner energy and perform feats of incredible strength and endurance. When you meditate for at least 10 minutes, you gain the following abilities:

  • Advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks for the next hour
  • Resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for the next hour
  • Regain 1d8 hit points for each hour of meditation

In addition, you are able to heal others through touch. When you lay your hands on a wounded creature, you may heal them for 1d8 hit points, plus an additional 1d8 hit points for each hour of meditation you have completed that day. You may only use this ability once per target per day.

name: Reef Blades Dwarf
description:
Expert Underwater Fighters

You are a member of the Reef Blades clan, a group of expert underwater fighters who use their magic to enhance their strength and agility in the water. When you are underwater, gain +1 ongoing to any move that involves physical combat.

Close Connection with the Sea

You have a close connection with the sea and its creatures. You can speak to any aquatic creature and understand its responses as if it were speaking your language.

Skilled Fishers and Divers

You are skilled in the arts of fishing and diving, and can hold your own in any underwater environment. You have +1 ongoing to any move that involves fishing or diving.

name: Coral Casters Dwarf
description:
Water and Earth Magic

You are a member of the Coral Casters clan, a group of magic-users who specialize in water and earth magic. When you cast a spell that involves water or earth, roll+Int. On a 18+ choose 2, on a 9-17 choose 1:

  • The spell is more powerful than you intended
  • You do not suffer any negative consequences from the spell
  • You can cast the spell again without spending any additional spell slots

Magical Tattoos

You have intricate tattoos on your body that are a mark of your magical prowess. When you use magic, your tattoos glow with a soft purple light.

Pearl Trader

You are skilled in the art of trading and can get better deals when buying or selling pearls. You have +1 ongoing to any move that involves pearl trading.

name: Seaborn Sentinel Dwarf
description:
Seaborn Sentinel

You are a member of the Seaborn Sentinels, a group of heavily-armored soldiers who are trained in the art of maritime warfare. You are known for your rare and stoic personality, which is a result of your fierce loyalty to your clan and your duty to defend your home.

When you fight on a ship or in any maritime environment, you gain the following moves:

  • Maritime Tactics: When you assess a maritime threat, roll+Wis. On a 18+, ask the GM 3 questions from the list below. On a 9-17, ask 1 question.
    • What here poses the biggest threat?
    • What here is the most vulnerable?
    • What is the enemy's objective?
    • What is the best way to take advantage of the environment?
  • Ironclad Defense: When you defend a ship or maritime territory, gain +1 armor.
  • Boarding Party: When you lead a boarding party, choose 1 additional benefit for your allies:
    • Advantage on their next attack roll
    • +1 forward to damage
    • Ignore armor

name: Ironclad
description: Armour and shields you wear or bear do not count against your Load (they weigh nothing). When you spend some time (about half an hour) to repair, maintain, and reinforce your armour, take +2 armour Forward.

name: Merciless
description: When you fight to kill and hold nothing back, your attacks are Brutal (you roll damage twice and take the best results) and you take +2 damage Forward.

name: Walk it Off
description: You restore debilities at a rate of three days, even without extensive rest or medical care.

name: Superior Warrior
description: When you Hack and Slash or Volley, on a 12+, you may choose to also impress, dismay, or frighten your enemies.

name: Whistlers Halfling
description:
Musical Talent

The Whistlers are known for their musical abilities, and they can use their talent to influence the emotions of those around them. When you use your musical abilities to help your allies, roll+Cha. On a 18+ they take +1 forward, on a 9-17 they take +1 forward, but you expose yourself to danger, retribution, or cost.

Skilled Fencers

The Whistlers are skilled fencers, and they use their agility and quick reflexes to outmaneuver their opponents. When you Hack and Slash with a finesse weapon, you can roll+Dex instead of +Str.

Whistling Cavalry

The Whistling Cavalry is a special army unit made up of skilled riders and archers who use their musical abilities to command and control their mounts in battle. When you fight from horseback, you can use your musical abilities to give orders to your mount. Your mount will obey your commands to the best of its ability, and you can use it to make attacks or move around the battlefield.

name: Sense of Unease
description: Whenever the bizarre and magical powers wielded by supernatural entities cause you to Defy Danger, treat any result of a 1-8 as a 9-17.

name: Weapon Soul Bounding
description:
When you take this move and spend some uninterrupted time meditating with your Signature Weapon, choose a special power from the list below. Your weapon gains this power as long as it is held by you.

  • Bane: It kills ________ (a specific type of creature; your choice) with but a single wound.
  • Divine: It is blessed by the gods, and is immediately recognisable as such.
  • Returning: It always returns to your hand.
  • Clearcutting: It cuts through wood and stone like butter.
  • Vorpal: It ignores armour and causes profuse bleeding.

name: Gatherer Halfling
description:
Foraging Expertise

You are a member of the Gatherers, a clan of halflings known for their foraging and gathering skills. You are an expert in identifying and collecting rare herbs and plants that can be used for medicinal or magical purposes. You have a +2 bonus to Discern Realities rolls when looking for herbs or plants, and you can always find food and water for yourself and your companions, even in the most barren and desolate of places.

Thievery Skills

You are also a skilled thief, trained in the art of stealth and agility. You have a +2 bonus to Defy Danger rolls when sneaking or stealing, and you can pick locks and pockets with ease. You can also use your agility to gain an advantage in combat, gaining a +1 bonus to Hack and Slash rolls when using a light or finesse weapon.

Herbalist Training

You have been trained as a Herbalist, a special army unit of the Gatherers that uses their knowledge of plants and their magical properties to create powerful potions and remedies for use in battle. You can spend a few hours and some herbs to create a potion that provides a specific effect, such as healing, strength, or invisibility. The GM will tell you what herbs you need and what the potion will do.

name: Acrobats Halfling
description:
Agile Performer

You are a member of the Acrobats Halfling clan, known for their agility and love of performance. You gain a +1 ongoing to defy danger using your acrobatic abilities. Additionally, you may use your acrobatic skills to distract your foes and aid your allies. When you perform a distracting maneuver, roll+Dex. On a 18+, choose 2. On a 9-17, choose 1:

  • Your allies gain +1 forward
  • Your foes take -1 ongoing
  • You create an opportunity for an ally to act without reprisal

These effects last until your next distracting maneuver.

name: Illusionists Halfling
description:
Mastery of Deception

You are a member of the Illusionists Halfling clan, known for their mastery of magic and love of deception. You can create illusions that are so convincing that they affect all senses. When you cast an illusion, roll+Int. On a 18+, choose 3. On a 9-17, choose 2:

  • The illusion is completely convincing to all senses
  • The illusion persists for as long as you concentrate, even if the target interacts with it
  • The illusion can affect multiple targets
  • The illusion can move and interact with the environment

The illusion lasts until you dismiss it or it is interacted with in a way that reveals its true nature. Additionally, you can use your illusions to create distractions or mislead your enemies. When you do, roll+Cha. On a 18+, choose 2. On a 9-17, choose 1:

  • Your foes are confused and disoriented, and take -1 ongoing
  • You create an opportunity for an ally to act without reprisal
  • Your foes reveal information or secrets to you

stats.stat_value: Training in illusion magic and deception

name: Stoneworkers Gnomes
description:
Stone Shapers

You are a member of the Stoneworkers, a clan of gnomes known for their expert craftsmanship and their ability to shape stone into intricate and beautiful works of art. When you work with stone, you gain a +1 forward to any rolls you make to shape or manipulate it.

Rare Work Ethic

You are known for your rare work ethic and your attention to detail. When you spend time working on a project, you may choose to take +1 ongoing to any rolls you make related to that project. However, you must also choose one of the following:

  • You work yourself to exhaustion, take -1 ongoing to all rolls until you rest
  • You neglect other duties or responsibilities, and may incur the wrath of someone who was counting on you

Stonemages

In times of war, the Stoneworkers have been known to use their stone-shaping abilities to create powerful magical weapons and armor for their special army unit, the Stonemages. When you enter battle, choose one of the following:

  • You wield a magical stone weapon that deals +1d6 damage, but is heavy and unwieldy (-1 ongoing to all rolls while wielding it)
  • You wear a magical stone armor that reduces damage taken by 1, but is cumbersome and slows you down (-1 ongoing to all rolls that require mobility or agility)
  • You carry a magical stone shield that grants you +1 armor, but is unwieldy and difficult to maneuver (-1 ongoing to all rolls that require dexterity or coordination)

name: Tinkerer Gnomes
description:
Tinkerers

The Tinkerers are a clan of gnomes located in the city of Syracuse. They are known for their love of experimentation and their natural curiosity. They are constantly coming up with new inventions and gadgets, and they are always looking for ways to improve upon existing technologies. They are often hired by other races to repair and maintain their machines and equipment, and they are known for their innovative and resourceful approach to problem-solving.

Dungeon World Moves:

  • Inventor: When you have time and materials to work with, you can invent a new device or gadget. Describe the device you want to create, and then roll+Int. On a 18+ choose 2, on a 9-17 choose 1:
    • The device works as intended
    • The device is reliable and won't break down easily
    • The device has additional features beyond its intended purpose
    • The device is safe to use
    On a miss, the device has significant flaws or dangers that the GM will describe to you.
  • Gadgeteer: You have an array of gadgets and tools at your disposal. Choose two gadgets from the list below, and describe them:
    • Steam-powered grappling hook
    • Explosive devices
    • Smoke bombs
    • Spring-loaded boots
    • Telescopic goggles
    • Teleportation device
    • Portable laboratory
    • Other (describe to the GM)
    You can use each gadget once per day, and each gadget has a different effect. The GM will describe the specifics of each gadget's effect when you use it.
  • Gnomish Artillery: When you lead a group of Tinkerers in battle, you can choose to form the Gnomish Artillery. This unit is made up of expert engineers who use their inventions and gadgets to rain destruction upon their foes. Choose a target within range, and roll+Dex. On a 18+ choose 2, on a 9-17 choose 1:
    • The target takes 1d10 damage
    • The target is stunned and cannot act next turn
    • The target is knocked back or off-balance
    • The attack doesn't cause collateral damage to allies or the environment
    On a miss, the attack has unintended consequences that the GM will describe to you.

name: Leafwalkers Gnomes
description:
The Leafwalkers

The Leafwalkers are a gnome race located in the Białowieża Forest. They are known for their stealthy and agile nature, making them skilled scouts and rangers. Their special army unit, the Leafblade Battalion, is a group of skilled warriors who wield magical, enchanted knives that allow them to teleport through trees. They are also highly respected for their ability to defend their forest homes from invaders.

  • Camouflage: You can blend in with your surroundings. When you stay still and quiet in natural surroundings, you are invisible to anyone who is not specifically searching for you. On a 18+, choose 3, on a 9-17 choose 2:
    • You can move slowly without breaking your camouflage
    • You can communicate with others without breaking your camouflage
    • You can take a basic action without breaking your camouflage
  • Teleport: When you use a Leafblade to teleport through a tree, roll+Dex. On a 18+ choose 3, on a 9-17 choose 2:
    • You arrive safely at your destination
    • You bring someone with you
    • You bring something with you
    • You leave no trace of your passage
  • Defend the Forest: When you defend your forest home from invaders, add +1 to your roll. On a 12+, choose 2, on a 10-11 choose 1:
