    • You drive off the invaders and they don't return
    • You learn something about their plans and weaknesses
    • You gain the support of a powerful ally in your forest home

name: Woodcarvers Gnomes
description:
The Woodcarvers

The Woodcarvers are a gnome race located in Val Gardena, a valley in the Dolomites. They are known for their artistic talent and their love of nature. They are skilled woodworkers, creating intricate and beautiful carvings and sculptures. However, they are also skilled in using these sculptures as weapons in war, imbuing them with magic to enhance their destructive power. They are often hired by other races to create and maintain their war machines, and they are known for their creativity and resourcefulness in battle.

  • Artistic Flair: You are a master of woodcarving and sculpture. When you create a work of art, roll+Cha. On a 18+, choose 3, on a 9-17 choose 2:
    • Your art inspires someone who sees it to take action on your behalf
    • Your art is imbued with magical power
    • Your art is noticed by someone important or influential
  • Wooden Weapon: When you fight with a wooden weapon, you may choose to imbue it with magic. Roll+Int. On a 18+, choose 2, on a 9-17 choose 1:
    • It deals +1d6 damage
    • It has the forceful tag
    • It has the igniting tag
  • Inventive Mind: When you create or repair a mechanical device or war machine, roll+Int. On a 18+, choose 3, on a 9-17 choose 2:
    • The device or machine works perfectly
    • The device or machine has an additional useful function
    • You learn something new about mechanical devices or war machines

name: Forest Lurker Goblins
description:
Stealthy Scouts

The Forest Lurker Goblins are skilled in the art of stealth and scouting. When you use the move Scout Ahead, you gain an additional option:

  • Leave no trace of your passing and don't trigger any traps or alarms

In addition, when you use the move Ambush, you gain an additional option:

  • Deal an extra 1d4 damage to a foe you ambush

Finally, when you use the move Hide in Shadows, you may remain hidden for as long as you wish, as long as you remain still and do not make any noise.

stats.stat_value: Born in the dense forests of the Bavarian region in Germany

name: Tree Eater Goblins
description:
Lumberjacks and Loggers

The Tree Eater Goblins are skilled in the art of cutting down trees and surviving in harsh environments. When you use the move Hack and Slash with an axe or other cutting tool, you gain an additional option:

  • Deal an extra 1d4 damage to a foe you hit

In addition, when you use the move Endure Hardship, you gain an additional option:

  • Ignore an additional point of damage from environmental hazards or extreme temperatures

Finally, when you use the move Drink, you may drink any alcoholic beverage without suffering any ill effects, and gain +1 forward when you do so.

stats.stat_value: Born in forests of the Carpathian Mountains

name: Hog Tamer Goblins
description:
Ferocious Hog Tamers

The Hog Tamer Goblins are a clan located in the Apennine Mountains in Italy. They are known for their ability to tame and train wild hogs, which they use as mounts in battle. These hogs are fiercely loyal to their Goblin handlers, and they are feared by their enemies on the battlefield. The Hog Tamers have a special army unit called the Hog Riders, a group of skilled warriors who use their hogs to charge into battle with devastating force.

  • Hog-Riding Expertise: You gain +1 ongoing when you Defy Danger while mounted on a hog.
  • Ferocious Charge: When you charge into battle on your hog, deal +1d4 damage to your enemies.
  • Hog Whisperer: You have a natural affinity with hogs. You can communicate with them, and you know how to calm them down and keep them under control.

name: Centaurs
description:
Noble Centaurs

The Centaurs are a proud race that live in the vast plains of Hungary. They are a nomadic people, but they are fiercely loyal to their homeland and their people. Centaurs have the lower body of a horse and the upper body of a human, which gives them great strength and agility. They are expert archers and hunters, and their knowledge of the land is unparalleled. Centaurs are also known for their wisdom and their sense of justice.

  • Bow Mastery: You gain +1 ongoing when you Volley with a bow.
  • Noble Steed: Your horse body is a powerful asset in battle. You can use it to trample your enemies or to escape danger quickly.
  • Master of the Plains: You know the plains like the back of your hand. You can always find food and water, and you know the best places to set up camp.

name: Minotaur
description:
Mighty Minotaurs

The Minotaurs are a race of powerful warriors that live in the labyrinthine caves of Greece. They have the head of a bull and the body of a human, which gives them incredible strength and endurance. Minotaurs are fierce fighters, and they are feared by their enemies on the battlefield. They are also skilled blacksmiths, and their weapons and armor are among the finest in the world.

  • Mighty Charge: When you charge into battle, deal +1d4 damage to your enemies.
  • Master Blacksmith: You are a skilled blacksmith, and you know how to create weapons and armor of exceptional quality.
  • Bull's Endurance: You have incredible stamina and endurance. You can push yourself beyond your limits and keep fighting even when others would have given up.

stats.stat_value: Born in the labyrinthine caves of Greece

name: Satyr
description:
Wild and Free

The Forest Satyrs are a race of creatures with the lower bodies of goats and the upper bodies of humans. They are known for their love of nature and their wild, free-spirited ways. They live in the dense forests of the Ardennes in present-day Belgium, where they roam freely and enjoy the company of other woodland creatures.

  • Wild Nature: You gain +1 ongoing to rolls when you are in a natural setting, such as a forest or meadow.
  • Pan Pipes: You can play haunting melodies on your pan pipes, which can soothe savage beasts or charm unsuspecting enemies.
  • Satyr's Grace: You have the natural grace of a wild creature. You are immune to the effects of difficult terrain, such as mud or thorny underbrush.

name: Ratfolk
description:
Sneaky and Resourceful

The City Ratfolk are a race of humanoid rodents who live in the bustling cities of Europe in the year 1444. They are known for their cunning and resourcefulness, as well as their ability to survive in the most inhospitable of environments. They are often found in the slums and back alleys of the great cities, where they make their living through a variety of trades and professions.

  • Scurry: You can move quickly and quietly through the tightest spaces, such as air ducts or sewers.
  • Scavenger: You have an eye for valuable or useful items that others might overlook. When you Search a location, you may find something unexpected.
  • Dirty Fighting: You are skilled in the art of dirty fighting. You can use any object as a weapon, and you can inflict +1d4 damage when you strike an unsuspecting foe.

stats.stat_value: Born in the slums of a city

name: Boarfolk
description:
Fierce Boar Warriors

The Boarfolk are a race of humanoid boars who live in the deep forests of the Ardennes in modern-day Belgium. They are known for their fierce fighting skills and their unbreakable spirit. The Boarfolk are a proud people, and they place a great emphasis on loyalty and honor. Their society is based on a warrior code, and their greatest heroes are those who have proven themselves in battle.

  • Ferocious Charge: When you charge into battle, deal +1d6 damage to your enemies.
  • Boarhide Toughness: You gain +1 Armor when you take damage while wearing no armor.
  • Boar's Nose: You have an acute sense of smell. You can track creatures by scent, and you can detect hidden or invisible enemies by scent alone.

stats.stat_value: Born in the Ardennes forest in Belgium

name: Insectfolk
description:
Mighty Insect Warriors

The Insectfolk are a race of humanoid insects who live in the dense forests of the Carpathian Mountains in modern-day Romania. They are known for their strength and their ability to work together as a hive mind. The Insectfolk have a highly organized society, with each member of the hive having a specific role to play. They are also skilled warriors, and their greatest heroes are those who have proven themselves in battle.

  • Insectoid Agility: You gain +1 ongoing when you Defy Danger using your speed or agility.
  • Insect Exoskeleton: You gain +1 Armor when you take damage while wearing no armor.
  • Mandibles of Death: When you hack and slash with your natural weapons (claws, mandibles, etc.), deal +1d4 damage.

stats.stat_value: Born in the Carpathian Mountains in Romania

name: Birdfolk (Eagle)
description:
The Eagle-Folk

The Eagle-Folk are a proud and noble race of bird-like people who reside in the alpine regions of Switzerland. They are known for their incredible eyesight and their ability to soar high above the mountains. The Eagle-Folk are a spiritual people, and they believe that they are the guardians of the mountains and the skies.

  • Eagle-Eyed: You have incredible eyesight. You can see for miles, and you can pick out small details from a great distance.
  • Wings of the Eagle: You can fly for short distances. When you use your wings to overcome an obstacle, roll+Dex. On a 18+, you overcome the obstacle with ease. On a 9-17, you succeed, but with a complication. On a miss, you fall or suffer harm.
  • Mountain Guardian: You are the guardian of the mountains. You have an innate sense of the terrain, and you know how to navigate even the most treacherous paths.

name: Owlkin Scholar
description:
Scholarly Wisdom

You are an Owlkin, a race of birdfolk known for their wisdom and knowledge. You have dedicated your life to the pursuit of knowledge, and have become a skilled wizard in the process. You have a natural affinity for magic, and are able to cast spells with ease. When you cast a spell, you may add your Intelligence modifier to the damage dealt or the healing provided.

In addition, you have the ability to see in the dark, as well as the ability to fly silently. You are also a skilled teacher, and are able to pass on your knowledge to others with ease. When you aid or interfere with someone who is using magic, you may roll+Int instead of +Bond.

Your knowledge has made you a valuable member of society, and you are often sought out for advice and guidance. However, you are also somewhat aloof, and tend to keep to yourself unless you feel that your knowledge is needed.

stats.stat_value: Born in the great library of Alexandria

name: Raven Birdfolk
description:
Winged Messengers of the Gods

The Raven Birdfolk are a race of bird-like beings with powerful wings and sharp beaks. They are known for their speed, their agility, and their ability to soar high into the sky. In the year 1444, they are found throughout the forests and mountains of Scotland, where they are revered as messengers of the gods.

  • Sharp Beak: Your beak is a deadly weapon. You deal +1d4 damage with it in combat.
  • Winged Flight: You can fly at great speed and maneuverability. You have a flight speed of 10 and can hover in place.
  • Messenger of the Gods: You have a special bond with the gods. You can communicate with them and ask for their guidance or aid. Once per day, you can ask the GM a question and they will answer truthfully.

stats.stat_value: Found throughout the forests and mountains of Scotland

name: Swan Birdfolk
description:
Graceful Dancers of the Lakes

The Swan Birdfolk are a race of bird-like beings with long, graceful necks and snowy-white feathers. They are known for their beauty, their elegance, and their ability to swim through the water with grace and speed. In the year 1444, they are found throughout the lakes and rivers of France, where they are admired for their skill as dancers and performers.

  • Graceful Dancer: You are a master of dance and movement. You gain +1 ongoing when you perform a dance or acrobatic maneuver.
  • Waterborne: You can swim through the water with ease. You have a swim speed of 10 and can hold your breath for an extended period of time.
  • Stunning Beauty: Your beauty is unmatched. When you reveal yourself to someone, they are momentarily stunned and unable to act.

stats.stat_value: Found throughout the lakes and rivers of France

name: Gnolls
description:
Savage Gnolls

The Gnolls are a race of savage hyena-like humanoids that dwell in the deep forests of central France. They are known for their ferocity in battle and their ability to track prey through the dense undergrowth. Despite their fearsome reputation, Gnolls are also skilled craftsmen and traders, and they have established trade routes throughout the region.

  • Feral Instincts: You have a natural sense of danger. When you Discern Realities, take +1.
  • Razor Claws: Your claws are razor-sharp. When you deal damage with them, add +1d4.
  • Master Tracker: You can track prey through any terrain, no matter how difficult. When you Undertake a Perilous Journey, you can never get lost.

stats.stat_value: Born in the deep forests of central France

name: Frogfolk
description:
Swamp-Dwelling Frogfolk

The Frogfolk are a race of humanoid frogs that dwell in the swamps of northern Spain. They are known for their agility and their ability to move through water with ease. Frogfolk society is organized around family units, and they are deeply committed to protecting their kin. They are also skilled hunters and gatherers, and they have developed a unique cuisine that features a variety of swamp creatures.

  • Swimming Expert: You are a natural swimmer. When you Defy Danger while swimming, take +1.
  • Sticky Tongue: Your tongue is incredibly sticky. You can use it to pull yourself towards an object, or to snatch an object from a distance.
  • Amphibious: You can breathe both air and water, and you are immune to drowning.

stats.stat_value: Born in the swamps of northern Spain

name: Natural Magic
description:
Magic is as natural as breath to you. Whenever you channel a spell, you can treat your open hand as if it was a wand or both of your open hands as if they were an arcane staff. Also, silver is anathema to you: it burns your skin. You also gain these bonds:

  • I will teach my magical secrets to someone worthy of them
  • I seek to learn the true nature of magic, no matter the cost

name: Pact with the Otherworld
description:
Your great power came with a price. You serve an otherworldly entity. When you Make Camp, you can commune with your patron and replace one of the words that you know with a random one. Also, when you want to achieve a powerful ritual, you can replace one of the requirements with “You have to sacrifice a certain creature”. You also gain these bonds:

  • I fear my patron, but I cannot resist their power
  • I will do whatever it takes to please my patron, even if it means betraying my allies

name: Wizardry Training
description:
When you have what you need, you can produce arcane raw chemicals and reagents, like lead dust or eye of newt. When you Cast a Spell, choose one:

  • Expend 1 use of Adventurer’s Gear to add +1 to your roll
  • Expend 1 use of Adventurer’s Gear to choose a different option from your spellcasting list

name: Lizardfolk
description:
Cold-Blooded Lizardfolk

The Lizardfolk are a race of cold-blooded humanoids that inhabit the marshes and swamps of Eastern Europe. They are known for their ability to adapt to any environment, and for their natural strength and resilience. The Lizardfolk have a complex social structure, with each tribe led by a powerful Shaman who is both a religious leader and a warrior.

  • Camouflage: When you stay still in a natural environment, you blend in with your surroundings and become nearly invisible.
  • Quick Reflexes: You have lightning-fast reflexes. When you act under fire, take +1 ongoing.
  • Predator's Instinct: You have an innate sense of your prey's movements. When you track a creature through the wilderness, take +1 ongoing to discern realities about it.

stats.stat_value: Inhabiting the marshes and swamps of Eastern Europe in the year 1444

name: Fishfolk
description:
Amphibious Fishfolk

The Fishfolk are a race of amphibious creatures that live in the rivers, lakes, and seas of Western Europe. They have the body of a fish and the arms and torso of a humanoid, and are able to breathe both air and water. The Fishfolk are skilled swimmers and fishermen, and their society is based around the importance of water and the worship of aquatic deities.

  • Aquatic Adaptation: You can breathe both air and water, and are immune to pressure and temperature changes in water.
  • Underwater Fighter: You have trained extensively in underwater combat. When you fight underwater, take +1 forward.
  • Fisherman's Luck: You have a natural talent for fishing. When you try to catch fish, take +1 forward.

stats.stat_value: Inhabiting the rivers, lakes, and seas of Western Europe in the year 1444

name: Spelltwine
description:
Requires also Arcane Knowledge

When you Cast a Spell, on a 12+, you may choose another spell you know to be simultaneously cast. Its Risk comes to pass.

name: Mercurial Blood
description:
Requires also Arcane Knowledge

When you Channel a spell, you no longer need to drink a dose of Quicksilver. You have made a ritual and now your blood has been replaced by quicksilver.

name: Master Channeler
description:
Requires also Arcane Knowledge

When you successfully channel a spell, you can choose to keep channeling to make it even stronger. Roll CON again as if you channeled the spell for the first time. You can repeat this process as many times as you want. On a 1-8 choose one for each extra time you channeled the spell: You draw unwelcome attention from a chaos being or put yourself in a spot. You take 1d6 damage. The spell also creates an unintended side effect. Gain a debility to an ability score You take 1d6 damage.

name: Sanctum
description: When you have time, arcane materials, and a safe space, you can create your own place of power for the Ritual move. Describe to the GM what kind of power it is and how you’re binding it to this place. In return, the GM will tell you one kind of creature that will have an interest in your workings.

name: Quick Study
description: When you see the effects of an arcane spell, you can ask the GM the name of the spell and its effects. You take +1 Forward to act on the answers.

name: Lurker
description: You know just how to move quickly and quietly through the black and the gloom. When you stand in shadows or darkness without talking or moving, NPCs will never see you as long as they haven’t already spotted you. If you’re more than a few feet away from them, they won’t see you even if you move or attack, and even if they know you’re there.

name: Scoundrel
description: You have a way with words, a trustworthy face, a suave demeanor. When you tell a lie or half-truth, it will be accepted as fact by anyone who doesn’t know any better. As long as no one reveals hard evidence to the contrary, anything you say will be accepted as open honesty.

name: Walker
description: You can climb along solid walls and ceilings as quickly as you can walk or run, regardless of their texture or composition, as long as they could support your weight. When you are climbing, you only have one hand free to take actions with; you may carry one person with you, but you can’t use your hands at all while you have a passenger.

name: Mercurial
description: You’re forgettable, inscrutable, or maybe just generic; you don’t mind. Whenever you want, you can change any or all of your looks. Those who know you can still recognise you, but only if they look closely.

name: Longsword
description:
Swordsman:

When you attack with a longsword, roll +Dex. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack inflicts a grievous wound, causing your target to take -1 ongoing to all rolls until they receive healing or medical attention
  • Your attack creates an opening, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target
  • Your attack stuns or knocks down your target, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quicklyact before they can react

Defensive Parry:

When you use a longsword to defend yourself, roll+Dex instead of +Con. On a 18+, you deflect theattack and take no damage. On a 9-17, you deflect the attack but suffer a -1 penalty to your nextattack roll.

name: Staff of Thunders
description:
Thunderstrike:

When you wield the staff of thunders and cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose to add the lightning tag to it. If you do, roll +Int. On a 18+, you deal your damage as normal and the target is deafened and stunned for a few moments. On a 9-17, you deal your damage as normal but the spell also affects you or an ally nearby, your choice. On a miss, the spell backfires and you take 1d6 damage.

Thunderclap:

When you slam the staff of thunders on the ground, you can spend one charge to create a loud thunderclap that can be heard for miles around. Anyone nearby who is not prepared for the noise must defy danger or be deafened and stunned for a few moments. The staff has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

name: Shield of the Gryphon
description:
Gryphon’s Flight:

When you strap the shield of the gryphon on your arm and leap into the air, you can spend one charge to fly for a short distance. You can carry up to your load while flying. You can use this ability to cross gaps, reach high places, or escape danger. The shield has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

Gryphon’s Roar:

When you hold the shield of the gryphon in front of you and shout a challenge, you can spend one charge to unleash a fearsome roar that echoes from the shield. Anyone who hears it must defy danger or flee in terror. The shield has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

name: Helmet of Courage
description:
Courageous Aura:

When you wear the helmet of courage, you and your allies nearby are immune to fear effects. You also gain +1 ongoing to defy danger when you act despite danger or fear.

Courageous Inspiration:

When you wear the helmet of courage and rally your allies with a speech or a gesture, roll +Cha. On a 18+, you and your allies take +1 forward to your next rolls. On a 9-17, you or one ally of your choice takes +1 forward to their next roll.

name: Whistle of the Eagles
description:
Eagle’s Call:

When you blow the whistle of the eagles, you can summon an eagle to aid you. The eagle is loyal to you and will follow your commands as best as it can. You can communicate with it telepathically as long as it is within sight. The eagle has these stats: HP 6, Armor 1, Damage d6, Instinct: To soar.

Eagle’s Eye:

When you blow the whistle of the eagles and look through its eyes, you can see what it sees as if you were there. You can use this ability to scout ahead, spy on enemies, or find hidden things. You cannot see or hear anything else while using this ability.

name: Potion of Heroism
description:
Heroic Boost:

When you drink the potion of heroism, you feel a surge of courage and strength. For the next hour, you gain +1 to all your rolls and you can mark one additional option when you hack and slash or volley. You also ignore the effects of fear, pain, and exhaustion. However, after the hour is over, you suffer a -1 ongoing to all your rolls until you rest.

name: Crossbow
description:
Crossbow Expert:

When you attack with a crossbow, roll +Dex. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 1 point of armor
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack pins your target to a wall or the ground, preventing them from moving until they free themselves

name: Heavy Crossbow
description:
Heavy Crossbow Expert:

When you attack with a heavy crossbow, roll +Str. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 2 points of armor
  • Your attack knocks your target back or off balance
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

name: Simple Bow
description:
Bow Expert:

When you attack with a simple bow, roll +Dex. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage. On a miss, you lose one ammo.

  • Your attack is silent and unnoticed
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage if you have the high ground or surprise

name: Composite Bow
description:
Composite Bow Expert:

When you attack with a composite bow, roll +Dex. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage. On a miss, you lose one ammo.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 1 point of armor
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage if you have the high ground or surprise

name: Longbow
description:
Longbow Expert:

When you attack with a longbow, roll +Dex. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage. On a miss, you lose one ammo.

  • Your attack has extreme range, reaching targets far beyond normal sight
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack deals +1d8 damage if you have the high ground or surprise

name: Arquebus
description:
Arquebus Expert:

When you attack with an arquebus, roll +Dex. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 2 points of armor
  • Your attack creates a loud bang and a flash of fire, startling or scaring anyone nearby who is not prepared for it
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage and sets your target or something nearby on fire

name: Heavy Blunderbuss
description:
Heavy Blunderbuss Expert:

When you attack with a heavy blunderbuss, roll +Str. On a 18+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 9-17, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 3 points of armor
  • Your attack creates a loud bang and a flash of fire, stunning or scaring anyone nearby who is not prepared for it
  • Your attack deals +1d8 damage and sets your target and anything nearby on fire

name: Club
description:
Brutal Smash:

When you attack with a club, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack breaks or damages something your target is holding or wearing
  • Your attack sends your target flying or sprawling, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can recover
  • Your attack dazes or disorients your target, giving them -1 forward to their next roll

Heavy Swing:

When you use a club to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Dagger
description:
Backstab:

When you attack a surprised or defenseless enemy with a dagger, roll +Dex. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage +1d6. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage +1d6 and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • You don’t get into melee with them
  • You create an advantage for an ally, giving them +1 forward against the target
  • You reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it

Quick Draw:

When you use a dagger to volley, you can draw and throw it as one fluid motion. You do not have to mark off ammo when you do this.

name: Estoc
description:
Pierce Armor:

When you attack with an estoc, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage and ignore the target’s armor. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and ignore the target’s armor and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack causes severe bleeding, dealing an extra 1d4 damage at the start of each of the target’s turns until they receive healing or medical attention
  • Your attack impales your target, pinning them to a nearby surface or object
  • Your attack exposes a weakness in your target’s defense, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target

Precise Thrust:

When you use an estoc to discern realities about an enemy’s combat style or weakness, you get +1 to the roll.

name: Halberd
description:
Sweeping Strike:

When you attack with a halberd, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack hits an additional nearby enemy
  • Your attack pushes your target back
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Reach Advantage:

When you use a halberd to defy danger by keeping enemies at bay, you get +1 to the roll.

name: Pike
description:
Skirmisher:

When you attack with a pike, roll +Dex. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack keeps your target at a distance, preventing them from closing in on you or an ally
  • Your attack allows you to move to a different position without provoking an opportunity attack
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Piercing Strike:

When you use a pike to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you ignore the target’s armor on a hit.

name: Greatsword
description:
Berserker:

When you attack with a greatsword, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack cleaves through multiple enemies, dealing your HA damage to another nearby enemy
  • Your attack unleashes a battle cry, inspiring fear or awe in your enemies and giving you or an ally +1 forward against them
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage

Reckless Swing:

When you use a greatsword to hack and slash, you can choose to expose yourself to danger. If you do, you add +2 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Greataxe
description:
Slayer:

When you attack with a greataxe, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack severs a limb or appendage of your target, disabling them in some way
  • Your attack triggers a blood frenzy, giving you +1 forward to your next attack roll
  • Your attack deals +1d8 damage

Savage Chop:

When you use a greataxe to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +4 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Greathammer
description:
Crusher:

When you attack with a greathammer, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack shatters or crushes something your target is holding or wearing
  • Your attack sends a shockwave, knocking down or stunning nearby enemies
  • Your attack deals +1d10 damage

Smite Evil:

When you use a greathammer to hack and slash an enemy of your deity or cause, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2d4 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Shortsword
description:
Duelist:

When you attack with a shortsword, roll +Dex. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack disarms your target, making them drop something they are holding
  • Your attack allows you to evade an incoming attack, giving you +1 armor until your next turn
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Quick Slash:

When you use a shortsword to hack and slash, you can choose to roll twice and take the better result. If you do, you expose yourself to danger.

name: Longsword
description:
Swordsman:

When you attack with a longsword, roll +Dex. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack inflicts a grievous wound, causing your target to take -1 ongoing to all rolls until they receive healing or medical attention
  • Your attack creates an opening, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target
  • Your attack stuns or knocks down your target, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quicklyact before they can react

Defensive Parry:

When you use a longsword to defend yourself, roll+Dex instead of +Con. On a 18+, you deflect theattack and take no damage. On a 9-17, you deflect the attack but suffer a -1 penalty to your nextattack roll.

name: Axe
description:
Hacker:

When you attack with an axe, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack chops off a limb or appendage of your target, disabling them in some way
  • Your attack triggers a blood frenzy, giving you +1 forward to your next attack roll
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage

Rage:

When you use an axe to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Mace
description:
Crusader:

When you attack with a mace, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack shatters or crushes something your target is holding or wearing
  • Your attack sends a shockwave, knocking down or stunning nearby enemies
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Divine Smite:

When you use a mace to hack and slash an enemy of your deity or cause, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2d4 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Gambeson armor
description:
Cushion:

When you wear gambeson armor, you get +1 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive). When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing gambeson armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d4.

Stealthy:

When you use gambeson armor to defy danger by sneaking or hiding, you get +1 to the roll. This armor is quiet and can be dyed to match different environments.

name: Plate armor
description:
Deflect:

When you wear plate armor, you get +3 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive). When you take damage from a slashing or piercing weapon while wearing plate armor, you can roll a d6. On a 6, you ignore the damage completely. On a 1-5, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d6.

Cushion:

When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing plate armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d4.

Bulky:

When you use plate armor to defy danger by being stealthy, agile, or swimming, you get -2 to the roll. When you take damage from electricity or magnetism while wearing plate armor, you take +1d8 damage and must defy danger to avoid being stunned or immobilized. This armor is made of metal, which conducts and attracts these forces.

name: Chainmail armor
description:
Dissipative:

When you wear chainmail armor, you get +2 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive). When you take damage from fire or acid while wearing chainmail armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d8.

Cushion:

When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing chainmail armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d4.

Clumsy:

When you use chainmail armor to defy danger by being stealthy or agile, you get -1 to the roll. This armor is noisy and heavy, making you more noticeable and slower.

name: Round Shield
description:
Shield Bash:

When you attack with a round shield, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage and push your target back. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack dazes or disorients your target, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against them
  • Your attack knocks your target off balance, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can recover
  • Your attack breaks or damages your target's weapon or armor, reducing its effectiveness

Shatter Shield:

When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your round shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.

name: Kite Shield
description:
Covering Fire:

When you use a kite shield to defend yourself or an ally from ranged attacks, roll+Con. On a 18+, you deflect or block the attacks and take no damage. On a 9-17, you deflect or block the attacks but suffer a -1 penalty to your next action.

Shatter Shield:

When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your kite shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.

name: Pavise Shield
description:
Deploy Shield:

When you set up a pavise shield as a cover, roll +Con. On a 9-17, you and anyone behind the shield gain +1 armor against ranged attacks. On a 18+, you and anyone behind the shield gain +2 armor against ranged attacks and are immune to explosions. On a 12+, you also gain +1 forward to your next action from behind the shield.

Shield Breaker:

When you attack with a pavise shield, roll +Str. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage and force your target to give ground. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack shatters or splinters your target's shield or armor, reducing its effectiveness
  • Your attack pushes your target into a dangerous position, such as off a cliff or into a trap
  • Your attack intimidates or demoralizes your target, causing them to surrender or flee

name: Buckler
description:
Quick Strike:

When you attack with a buckler, roll +Dex. On a 9-17, you deal your HA damage and gain +1 armor until your next action. On a 18+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack exposes or exploits a weakness in your target's defense, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against them
  • Your attack disarms or distracts your target, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can react
  • Your attack stuns or wounds your target, causing them to take -1 ongoing to all rolls until they receive healing or medical attention

Dodge and Parry:

When you use a buckler to defend yourself in close quarters, roll+Dex instead of +Con. On a 18+, you evade or deflect the attack and take no damage. On a 9-17, you evade or deflect the attack but suffer a -1 penalty to your next action.

name: Adventuring Gear
description:
Have What You Need:

When you rummage through your adventuring gear for some useful mundane item, mark off a use and you have it. The GM might ask you what it looks like or how you got it.

name: Bag of Books
description:
Bookworm:

When you spout lore about something and your bag of books contains just the right book for the subject, mark off a use and take +1 to your roll.

name: Halfling Pipeleaf
description:
Friendly Smoke:

When you share halfling pipeleaf with someone, expend two uses and take +1 forward to parley with them. The GM might also tell you something interesting or useful that they reveal during the conversation.

name: Bandages
description:
Patch Up:

When you have a few minutes to bandage someone else’s wounds, mark off a use and heal them 4 damage.

Tender Care:

When you carefully treat someone else’s wounds with bandages and rest, mark off a use and heal them 7 damage.

name: Large Backpack / Bag
description:
Carry On:

A large backpack or bag can hold up to 25 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

name: Small Crate, Sack or Chest
description:
Store Away:

A small crate, sack or chest can hold up to 20 load of items. You need to spend some time to find a specific item in your crate, sack or chest.

name: Big Crate, Sack or Chest
description:
Store Away:

A big crate, sack or chest can hold up to 40 load of items. You need to spend some time to find a specific item in your crate, sack or chest.

name: Antitoxin
description:
Poison Cure:

When you drink antitoxin, cure one poison affecting you. The GM will tell you what effects the poison had and how you feel after taking the antitoxin.

name: Small Backpack / Bag
description:
Carry On:

A small backpack or bag can hold up to 6 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

name: Medium Backpack / Bag
description:
Carry On:

A medium backpack or bag can hold up to 13 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

name: Dungeon Rations
description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Dungeon rations are bland but nourishing.

name: Dwarven Hardtack Ration
description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Dwarven hardtack rations are tough and dry but filling.

Stout Heart:

When you consume a ration, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next defy danger roll with CON.

name: Elven Bread Ration
description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Elven bread rations are light and sweet but satisfying.

Graceful Step:

When you consume a ration, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next defy danger roll with DEX.

name: A Hearty Meal for One
description:
Nourishment:

When you enjoy a hearty meal for one, you heal 2 damage and remove one debility of your choice.

Comfort:

When you enjoy a hearty meal for one, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next parley or discern realities roll.

name: A Poor Meal for a Family
description:
Sustenance:

When you share a poor meal for a family, you and up to three others don’t need to eat for a day. A poor meal for a family is meager and bland but enough to survive.

Hardship:

When you share a poor meal for a family, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next defy danger roll with WIS.

name: A Feast
description:
Nourishment:

When you partake in a feast, you heal 4 damage and remove two debilities of your choice.

Celebration:

When you partake in a feast, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next carouse or aid or interfere roll.

name: 1 kg of Wheat
description:
Bread and Butter:

When you use 1 kg of wheat to make bread or other food, mark off the wheat and you have enough food for one person for a day.

Barter Goods:

When you trade 1 kg of wheat with someone who needs it, mark off the wheat and take +1 forward to your next parley roll with them.

name: 1 kg of Steel
description:
Material:

When you use 1 kg of steel to craft or repair a weapon or armor, mark off the steel and you have enough material for the job.

Barter Goods:

When you trade 1 kg of steel with someone who needs it, mark off the steel and take +1 forward to your next parley roll with them.

name: 1 kg of Gold
description:
Money:

When you use 1 kg of gold to buy something, mark off the gold and you have enough money for the purchase. 1 kg of gold is equivalent to 100
